=== Path traversal vulnerability ===
=== Path traversal vulnerability ===
In February 2008, CoreSecurity.com discovered a vulnerability in the Shared Folders function within several VMware products, including Workstation. A user logged onto a guest VM running in VMware Workstation could gain read/write access to the host system by specifying a pathname with the ".." substring.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.coresecurity.com/?action=item&id=2129 |title=Path Traversal vulnerability in VMware's shared folders implementation |date=[[2008-02-25]] |accessdate=2008-03-07 |publisher=CoreSecurity}}</ref><ref name=iw_vmware_sf>{{Cite web |title=VMWare desktop vulnerability exposed |last=Hines |first=Matt |publisher=InfoWorld |accessdate=2008-03-07 |date=[[2008-02-25]] |url=http://weblog.infoworld.com/zeroday/archives/2008/02/virtualization.html?source=rss}}</ref> However, the host is only vulnerable if the shared folders are turned on and at least one host folder is set for sharing. This vulnerability was fixed in VMware Workstation versions 5.5.6 and 6.0.3.
In February 2008, CoreSecurity.com discovered a vulnerability in the Shared Folders function within several VMware products, including Workstation. A user logged onto a guest VM running in VMware Workstation could gain read/write access to the host system by specifying a pathname with the ".." substring.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.coresecurity.com/?action=item&id=2129 |title=Path Traversal vulnerability in VMware's shared folders implementation |date=[[2008-02-25]] |accessdate=2008-03-07 |publisher=CoreSecurity}}</ref><ref name=iw_vmware_sf>{{Cite web |title=VMWare desktop vulnerability exposed |last=Hines |first=Matt |publisher=InfoWorld |accessdate=2008-03-07 |date=[[2008-02-25]] |url=http://weblog.infoworld.com/zeroday/archives/2008/02/virtualization.html?source=rss}}</ref> However, the host is only vulnerable if the shared folders are turned on and at least one host folder is set for sharing. This vulnerability was fixed in VMware Workstation versions 5.5.6 and 6.0.3.
